--- Comment #3 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Fixed in svn rev 85780,
using a version of your comment 1 proposal to improve the 2 `binom_raw()`
extremal cases (x=0 and x=n).

As noted indirectly, in theory we'd like to improve also the more general case,
for `binom_raw()`, when the result should not be log-ed.
I left a `TODO` , `#ifdef`ed out, for now.
That would be a new bugzilla issue in any case.

text:
*[Bug 18616] TukeyHSD not functioning properly with nested designs*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18616>

--- Comment #2 from Flavio Bello Fialho (<mailto:bello.flavio@gmail.com|bello.flavio@gmail.com>) ---
(In reply to Elin Waring from comment #1)
The problem is that the results given by TukeyHSD are incorrect, because it
considers an incorrect number of means in the comparison. The patch removes
unexisting means (those where n=0) form the analysis. My concern is whether
there are any downsides to this which I am not aware of.

As for the use case, I think nested designs are general and common enough to be
considered when evaluating if the function is working correctly.

I have been using the patched function for some time now, and I think it would
be convenient if this bug was fixed in the source.

elements.text: [Bug 18616] TukeyHSD not functioning properly with nested designs

) ---
(In reply to Elin Waring from comment #1)
The problem is that the results given by TukeyHSD are incorrect, because it
considers an incorrect number of means in the comparison. The patch removes
unexisting means (those where n=0) form the analysis. My concern is whether
there are any downsides to this which I am not aware of.

As for the use case, I think nested designs are general and common enough to be
considered when evaluating if the function is working correctly.

I have been using the patched function for some time now, and I think it would
be convenient if this bug was fixed in the source.

text:
*[Bug 18648] New: tools::startDynamicHelp(): Can get stuck in "server could not be started on an earlier attempt" state*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18648>

            Bug ID: 18648
           Summary: tools::startDynamicHelp(): Can get stuck in "server
                    could not be started on an earlier attempt" state
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.3.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Misc
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:henrikb@braju.com|henrikb@braju.com>

If we disable the dynamic help server *temporarily*:

```
$ R --vanilla
R version 4.3.2 (2023-10-31) -- "Eye Holes"
Copyright (C) 2023 The R Foundation for Statistical Computing
Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit)
...

> Sys.setenv("R_DISABLE_HTTPD" = "true")
> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(NA)
Warning in tools::startDynamicHelp(NA) :
  httpd server disabled by R_DISABLE_HTTPD

> print(port)
[1] -1

> Sys.unsetenv("R_DISABLE_HTTPD")
```

and then attempt to start the dynamic help server, it will always fail:

```
> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(TRUE)
Error in tools::startDynamicHelp(TRUE) : 
  server could not be started on an earlier attempt
```

```
> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(NA)
Error in startDynamicHelp(TRUE) : 
  server could not be started on an earlier attempt
```

It is also not possible to reset it by trying to stop it, e.g.

```
> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(FALSE)
Error in tools::startDynamicHelp(FALSE) : no running server to stop
```

This does not look like an intended behavior.


# Troubleshooting

Looking at the code, it looks it cannot get out of the internal -1 state;

```
> tools:::httpdPort()
[1] -1
```

We can force it out of this state by resetting the internal port variable;

```
> tools:::httpdPort(0L)
> tools:::httpdPort()
[1] 0
```

After this, we can launch the help server again:

```
> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(TRUE)
starting httpd help server ... done
> port
[1] 24396
```

It is also not possible to reset it by trying to stop it, e.g.

Error in tools::startDynamicHelp(FALSE) : no running server to stop
We can force it out of this state by resetting the internal port variable;
After this, we can launch the help server again:

> port <- tools::startDynamicHelp(TRUE)
starting httpd help server ... done

[1] 24396
